page.title: 04PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The Parish of Christ Church, Long Lane extends over 3000 acres taken in 1859 from the adjacent Parishes of Trusley, Sutton-on-the-Hill and Brailsford; the Parish Church was built in the same year, the Tower and Vestry being added in 1874. The Parish Priest lives in Long Lane, but has charge also of the Parishes of Dalbury, Longford and Radbourne. In what is an entirely rural area, much of the Parish Priest's time is taken up with the day-to-day needs of the four Parishes, in necessary visiting and pastoral care. The Sunday services are shared amongst the Churches by common consent, the time and form of the services varying week by week. The Parish Priest depends heavily on the strong support and goodwill of parishioners.Opposite the church is an obsolete Methodist Chapel built 1858.
